body_html:
Still having timeout after setting up the time out. Adding double quotes or simply running patch instead of bash patch works. I fixed it by commenting then line where cmd is wraped with bash to run patch directly from msys2.

@arunmandal53 - Can you try adding more timeout? I saw in patch that timeout was increased to be 60.. Anyway, I built tensorflow on Surface 3 (Non-Pro) (CPU ATOM), I have to use like 200 in order to not getting Timeout.
body_text:
Still having timeout after setting up the time out. Adding double quotes or simply running patch instead of bash patch works. I fixed it by commenting then line where cmd is wraped with bash to run patch directly from msys2.

@arunmandal53 - Can you try adding more timeout? I saw in patch that timeout was increased to be 60.. Anyway, I built tensorflow on Surface 3 (Non-Pro) (CPU ATOM), I have to use like 200 in order to not getting Timeout.
body:
> Still having timeout after setting up the time out. Adding double quotes or simply running patch instead of bash patch works. I fixed it by commenting then line where cmd is wraped with bash to run patch directly from msys2.

@arunmandal53 - Can you try adding more timeout? I saw in patch that timeout was increased to be 60.. Anyway, I built tensorflow on Surface 3 (Non-Pro) (CPU ATOM), I have to use like 200 in order to not getting Timeout.
